pullRequest.body:
---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
### PR summary [dacb27818f](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/18943/commits/dacb27818f7ee282f597847cd4ef73df266ae631)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

#### Declarations diff

No declarations were harmed in the making of this PR! üêô
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

---

<details><summary>Changes to technical debt</summary>

|Current number|Change|Type|
|-:|:-:|:-|
|5101|-21|porting notes|
|223|-17|disabled simpNF lints|

Current commit [dacb27818f](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/commit/dacb27818f7ee282f597847cd4ef73df266ae631)
Reference commit [7a856f8bb0](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/commit/7a856f8bb0a737386bb4d274447bd5567d6aea40)

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
</details>

:v: kim-em can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

Testing a new entry to the `PR summary` script.  For this PR, it would report the following:

---

<details><summary>Changes to technical debts</summary>

|Current number|Change|Type|
|-:|:-:|:-|
|5109|-20|porting notes|
|229|-11|disabled simpNF lints|

Current commit [651df49d2d](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/commit/651df49d2d8c69f4316603922bd6a800e4bf4072)
Reference commit [6a85082cb2](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/commit/6a85082cb2ae80ff81a30ecea04bcbf258d51402)

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
</details>
Might it be better to do `attribute [-simp] FintypeCat.toProfinite_map_apply` here? That way we can remove the `nolint simpNF`? I'm happy either way round.
@b-mehta this doesn't actually work. `attribute [-simp]` is only file local.
This porting note looks like it matches #18942 exactly, perhaps we should add a link to that to the comment earlier (on line 28). And then it's not really a porting note any more!
If this isn't being used as a `simp` lemma, I think it's fine to remove the attribute outright. This `BFamily` API has no reason to be used in any new theorems and is planned to be deprecated soon.

pullRequest.title: chore: more cleanup of nolint simpNF
